feeds.source: The Record from Recorded Future News

items.title: Lawmaker calls facial recognition on doorbell cameras a ‘privacy nightmare’
items.summary: Sen. Ed Markey (D-MA) asked Ring in October about its privacy policies and how it intends to protect individuals recorded by its new facial recognition technology feature called Familiar Faces.

items.title: DOJ, CISA warn of Russia-linked attacks targeting meat processing plants, nuclear regulatory entities and other critical infrastructure
items.summary: The Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA), alongside several other U.S. and international agencies, released an advisory covering the cyberattacks launched by CyberArmyofRussia_Reborn (CARR), NoName057(16) and several related groups.

items.title: Flock cameras remained active in two cities where officials had asked for them to be turned off
items.summary: Officials in Cambridge, Massachusetts, and Eugene, Oregon, found that some Flock Safety license plate readers were still active after the municipalities asked for services to be terminated.

items.title: US extradites member of Russian hacktivist group involved in critical infrastructure attacks
items.summary: The Justice Department unveiled two indictments on Tuesday evening charging Victoria Eduardovna Dubranova for her alleged roles in CyberArmyofRussia_Reborn (CARR) and NoName057(16), two groups known for attacking critical infrastructure.

items.title: Teen who allegedly stole millions of personal data records arrested in Spain
items.summary: Spanish police accused a 19-year-old man of stealing 64 million personal data records from multiple companies and attempting to sell them on hacker forums.

items.title: Russia’s flagship airline hacked through little-known tech vendor, according to new report
items.summary: The breach, which was claimed by the pro-Ukrainian hacker collective Silent Crow and the allied Belarusian Cyber-Partisans, paralyzed Aeroflot’s operations, grounding more than a hundred flights.

items.title: Senators return to effort to boost cybersecurity for commercial satellite industry
items.summary: Sens. John Cornyn and Gary Peters are taking another crack at moving legislation meant to help commercial satellite providers defend their networks.

items.title: British government sanctions Russian and Chinese groups over information warfare
items.summary: The U.K.'s foreign secretary announced sanctions on seven Russian individuals and influence networks, as well as the Chinese companies i-Soon and Integrity Technology Group.

items.title: California man pleads guilty to RICO charges as DOJ indicts crypto theft gang
items.summary: Evan Tangeman became the ninth person to plead guilty as part of a wider Justice Department takedown of a criminal group known as the Social Engineering Enterprise.
